Pre-Game Insights: The New York Yankees and the Chicago Cubs meet Sunday in MLB action from Wrigley Field.
This will be the final installment in a three-game series.
The Yankees played the Texas Rangers in their last series. New York lost two of those three games, but then beat Chicago in their Friday opener.
On Saturday the Yankees kept it up with a 2-0 shutout win.
In the Sunday finale the Yankees will send out Gerrit Cole as starter. This year Cole is 6-3 with a 3.65 ERA in 13 starts.
Chicago Cubs played the Pittsburgh Pirates in their last set. Chicago similarly lost two of those three games.
On Saturday the Cubs posted four team hits and two errors.
Chicago got 5.2 innings and one earned run from starter Javier Assad.
It’ll be Jameson Taillon in the start for the Cubs on Sunday. Over 24 starts this year Taillon is 9-8 with a 3.66 ERA.
